page.title: 11Alsager Peat Moss
page.content: An area of 95 acres of the land surrounding (Moss Farm) is under excavation for sedge peat. Thirty acres have been extracted to date and it is estimated that five thousand tons of peat are produced in one year at this farm. The peat is dug to the underlying sand by means of mechanical digger and left to dry for two years. Russian peat is added to aid the drying process. The peat is sold to nurseries, D.I.Y. and garden centres mainly in the north west of England. In recent years it was sent to Manchester United and Everton football grounds, and this year forty thousand tons of peat has been transported to the Stoke-on-Trent garden festival site. Aspects of conservation are taken into account and there is evidence of nesting ducks, pheasants, snipe and foxes.
